howToUse.title: How to Use the Japanese Translator
howToUse.intro: Our free Japanese translator makes it easy to translate text between English and Japanese. Here's how to get started:

steps.step1: Enter your text in the input field on the left
steps.step2: Select your source language (English or Japanese)
steps.step3: Click the translate button or press Ctrl+Enter
steps.step4: View your translation with romanization (romaji) for Japanese text
steps.step5: Copy the translation or save it to your history

howToUse.proTip: Pro tip: Use the swap button to quickly reverse the translation direction and translate the output back.

writingSystems.title: About Japanese Writing Systems
writingSystems.intro: Japanese uses three main writing systems, often combined in the same text:

hiragana.name: Hiragana (ひらがな)
hiragana.description: A phonetic syllabary used for native Japanese words, grammatical elements, and furigana readings

katakana.name: Katakana (カタカナ)
katakana.description: A phonetic syllabary primarily used for foreign loanwords, onomatopoeia, and emphasis

kanji.name: Kanji (漢字)
kanji.description: Chinese characters adapted for Japanese, representing meanings and concepts. There are over 2,000 commonly used kanji

writingSystems.outro: Our translator handles all three writing systems and provides romanization (romaji) to help you read Japanese text using the Latin alphabet.

isFree.question: Is this Japanese translator free?
isFree.answer: Yes! Our Japanese translator is completely free to use with no registration required. Translate as much text as you need.

accuracy.question: How accurate is the translation?
accuracy.answer: Our translator uses Google Cloud Translation API, one of the most accurate machine translation services available. While no machine translation is perfect, it provides high-quality translations for most everyday use cases.

romanization.question: What is romanization (romaji)?
romanization.answer: Romanization, or romaji, is the representation of Japanese text using the Latin alphabet. It helps non-Japanese speakers read and pronounce Japanese words. Our translator automatically provides romanization for Japanese text.

historySaved.question: Is my translation history saved?
historySaved.answer: Yes, your translation history is saved locally in your browser. This means your translations are private and only accessible on your device. You can clear your history at any time.

maxLength.question: What is the maximum text length?
maxLength.answer: You can translate up to 5,000 characters at a time. For longer texts, we recommend breaking them into smaller sections.
